ARABIC: فَسُبْحَٰنَ ٱللَّهِ حِينَ تُمْسُونَ وَحِينَ تُصْبِحُونَ

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: So glory be to Allah when you start the night and when you greet the day.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: So extol God when the evening comes and the day dawns,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: So glorify Allah in the evening and the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: Glory belongs to God all the time, in the evening and in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: So proclaim the Purity of Allah when you witness the night and the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: So glorify Allah, when you enter the evening, and when you enter the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: Therefore glory be to Allah when you enter upon the time of the evening and when you enter upon the time of the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: So glory be to God both in your evening hour and in your morning hour.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: So glory be to Allah when ye enter the night and when ye enter the morning -
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: So glorify God in the evening and in the morning,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: So hallow Allah when ye enter the night and when ye enter the morning, --
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: So glorify Allah when you enter evening and when you rise at dawn.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: So (give) glory to Allah, when ye reach eventide and when ye rise in the morning;
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: So glorify Allah [above all that (evil) they associate with Him (O believers)], when you come up to the evening [i.e. offer the (Maghrib) sunset and ('Isha') night prayers], and when you enter the morning [i.e. offer the (Fajr) morning prayer].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: Therefore, exalt Allah when you enter the evening and in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: So glorify God when you retire at night, and when you rise in the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: So exalted is Allah when you reach the evening and when you reach the morning.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [30:17] So glory be to God — in other words, [so] glorify God, meaning: perform prayer — when you enter the [time of the] night, in which there are two prayers, the sunset one (maghrib) and the later night one (‘ishā’), and when you rise in the morning, in which there is the morning prayer (subh).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (So glory be to Allah) so pray to Allah (when ye enter the night) the prayers of Maghrib and 'Isha' (and when ye enter the morning) the prayer of Fajr.
